Col0: The benchmark price of apartments decreased 2.7 per cent in the region last year. Townhomes
decreased 2.4 per cent and detached homes decreased four per cent.
Both detached home and townhome benchmark prices increased 22 per cent in the region last
year, while apartments increased 12.8 per cent.
Looking across Metro Vancouver, Maple Ridge saw the largest increase in benchmark prices at
34.7 per cent, followed by Pitt Meadows (29.8 per cent), and Whistler (27.8 per cent).
Looking at area and property type, detached homes in Pitt Meadows saw the largest benchmark
